alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms with gusty winds and heavy downpours will impact portions of Forsyth County through 130 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pilot Mountain to Rockford, or about 20 miles northwest of Winston-Salem. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Huntsville, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Pfafftown and Belews Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
